member.summary: Performs a search on all the tags of the audio tracks in this account, and returns a collection of audio tracks that contain the specified tags. Note that tags are case-sensitive.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.DeleteAudioTrack(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes an audio track, specified by ID.
member.param: The ID of the audio track you'd like to delete
If true, audio track will be deleted even if it is part of a manual playlist or assigned to a player. The audio track will be removed from all playlists and players in which it appears, then deleted.

Set this to true if you want also to delete shared copies of this audio track. Note that this will delete all shared copies from your account, as well as from all accounts with which the audio track has been shared, regardless of whether or not those accounts are currently using the audio track in playlists or players.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.DeleteAudioTrack(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a audio track, specified by the reference ID.
member.param: The reference ID of the audio track you'd like to delete
If true, audio track will be deleted even if it is part of a manual playlist or assigned to a player. The audio track will be removed from all playlists and players in which it appears, then deleted.

Set this to true if you want also to delete shared copies of this audio track. Note that this will delete all shared copies from your account, as well as from all accounts with which the audio track has been shared, regardless of whether or not those accounts are currently using the audio track in playlists or players.

Note that this will delete all shared copies from your account, as well as from all accounts with which the audio track has been shared, regardless of whether or not those accounts are currently using the audio track in playlists or players.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.UpdatePlaylist(BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist)
member.summary: Updates a playlist, specified by playlist ID or reference ID. Either a playlist ID or a reference ID must be supplied. If you are updating the value of the reference ID, then both the playlist ID and reference ID must be supplied.
member.param: The playlist you'd like to update.
member.returns: The playlist that was updated

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.DeletePlaylist(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a playlist, specified by playlist ID
member.param: The ID of the playlist you'd like to delete
If true, playlist will be deleted even if it is referenced by players. The playlist will be removed from all players in which it appears, then deleted.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.DeletePlaylist(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a playlist, specified by the playlist's Reference ID
member.param: The Reference ID of the playlist you'd like to delete
If true, playlist will be deleted even if it is referenced by players. The playlist will be removed from all players in which it appears, then deleted.

A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. member.returns: The Video you requested, with the specified fields populated, or null, if there is no video with that id.

member.summary: Find multiple videos, given their ids.
member.param: The list of video ids for the videos to retrieve.

A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. member.summary: Searches videos according to the criteria provided by the user.
member.param: Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria that MUST be present in the index in order to return a hit in the result set. If the field's name is not present, it will search among the name, shortDescription, and longDescription fields by default.

Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria AT LEAST ONE of which must be present to return a hit in the result set. If the field's name is not present, it will search among the name, shortDescription, and longDescription fields by default.

Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria that MUST NOT be present to return a hit in the result set. If the field's name is not present, it will search among the name, shortDescription, and longDescription fields by default.
Number of items returned per page. (max 100)
The zero-indexed number of the page to return.

If true, disables fuzzy search and requires an exact match of search terms. A fuzzy search does not require an exact match of the indexed terms, but will return a hit for terms that are closely related based on language-specific criteria. The fuzzy search is available only if your account is based in the United States.
Specifies the by which to sort results.

A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publisheddate, lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If true, also return how many total results there are.
member.returns: A collection of videos matching the specified criteria.

Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria AT LEAST ONE of which must be present to return a hit in the result set. If the field's name is not present, it will search among the name, shortDescription, and longDescription fields by default.

Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria that MUST NOT be present to return a hit in the result set. If the field's name is not present, it will search among the name, shortDescription, and longDescription fields by default.
Number of items returned per page. (max 100)
The zero-indexed number of the page to return.

If true, disables fuzzy search and requires an exact match of search terms. A fuzzy search does not require an exact match of the indexed terms, but will return a hit for terms that are closely related based on language-specific criteria. The fuzzy search is available only if your account is based in the United States.
member.returns: A collection of videos matching the specified criteria.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.FindRelatedVideos(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds videos related to the given video. Combines the name and short description of the given video and searches for any partial matches in the name, description, and tags of all videos in the Brightcove media library for this account.
member.param: The parameter by which related videos are determined.
The parameter value by which related videos are determined.
Number of items returned per page. A page is a subset of all of the items that satisfy the request. The maximum page size is 100.
The zero-indexed number of the page to return

A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publisheddate, lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.

A list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value 'customFields' in the video_fields parameter.
If true, also return how many total results there are.
member.returns: A collection of videos, ordered by relevance to the provided video.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.CreateVideo(BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo,BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.Connectors.FileUploadInfo,BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.EncodeTo,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new video by uploading a file.
member.param: The metadata for the video you want to create.
Information for the file to be uploaded.

If the file requires transcoding, use this parameter to specify the target encoding. Valid values are MP4 or FLV, representing the H264 and VP6 codecs respectively. Note that transcoding of FLV files to another codec is not currently supported. This parameter is optional and defaults to FLV.

If the file is a supported transcodeable type, this optional flag can be used to control the number of transcoded renditions. If true (default), multiple renditions at varying encoding rates and dimensions are created. Setting this to false will cause a single transcoded VP6 rendition to be created at the standard encoding rate and dimensions.
If the video file is H.264 encoded and if createMultipleRenditions is true, then multiple VP6 renditions are created and in addition the H.264 source is retained as an additional rendition.
Use this option to prevent H.264 source files from being transcoded. This parameter cannot be used in combination with create_multiple_renditions. It is optional and defaults to false.
member.returns: The numeric ID of the newly created video.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.CreateVideo(BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo,System.String,BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.EncodeTo,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

If the video file is H.264 encoded and if createMultipleRenditions is true, then multiple VP6 renditions are created and in addition the H.264 source is retained as an additional rendition.
Use this option to prevent H.264 source files from being transcoded. This parameter cannot be used in combination with create_multiple_renditions. It is optional and defaults to false.
member.returns: The numeric ID of the newly created video.

If the file is a supported transcodeable type, this optional flag can be used to control the number of transcoded renditions. If true (default), multiple renditions at varying encoding rates and dimensions are created. Setting this to false will cause a single transcoded VP6 rendition to be created at the standard encoding rate and dimensions.
member.returns: The numeric ID of the newly created video.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.DeleteVideo(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a video, specified by video ID
member.param: The ID of the video you'd like to delete
If true, video will be deleted even if it is part of a manual playlist or assigned to a player. The video will be removed from all playlists and players in which it appears, then deleted.

Set this to true if you want also to delete shared copies of this video. Note that this will delete all shared copies from your account, as well as from all accounts with which the video has been shared, regardless of whether or not those accounts are currently using the video in playlists or players.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.ShareVideo(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Shares the specified video with a list of sharee accounts.
member.param: The id for the video that will be shared.

If the target account has the option enabled, setting this flag to true will bypass the approval process, causing the shared video to automatically appear in the target account's library. If the target account does not have the option enabled, or this flag is unspecified or false, then the shared video will be queued up to be approved by the target account before appearing in their library.
If true, indicates that if the shared video already exists in the target account's library, it should be overwritten by the video in the sharer's account.
List of Account IDs to share video with.
member.returns: List of new video IDs (one for each account ID).

member.returns: A collection of sharee account IDs for accounts previously containing shared videos specifically removed by this method.

member.summary: Find all playlists in this account.
member.param: Number of playlists returned per page. A page is a subset of all of the playlists that satisfy the request. The maximum page size is 50.
The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
The property that you'd like to sort the results by.
The order that you'd like the results sorted - ascending or descending.

A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the playlists. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the Video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publisheddate, lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns the Videos' FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Playlists contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, all playlist fields are returned.

A list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value 'customFields' in the video_fields parameter.
If true, also return how many total results there are.
member.returns: A collection of Playlists that is the specified subset of all the playlists in this account.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindAllVideos
member.summary: Find all videos in the Video Cloud media library for this account. This method has the limitation of returning only videos available for play, and does not include videos marked as inactive, currently in the upload process, or outside the scheduled play time.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.SearchVideos
member.summary: Searches videos according to the criteria provided by the user. The criteria are constructed using field/value pairs specified in the command. Consider using the search_videos method for video searches rather than using the other find_video read methods. The search_videos method offers more flexible search and sorting options than the find_video methods, and is especially more flexible than the find_videos_by_text and find_videos_by_tags methods.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindRelatedVideos
member.summary: Finds videos related to the given video. Combines the name and short description of the given video and searches for any partial matches in the name, short description, long description, tags, and custom fields of all videos in the Video Cloud media library for this account. More precise ways of finding related videos include tagging your videos by subject and using the find_videos_by_tags method to find videos that share the same tags: or creating a playlist that includes videos that you know are related. Consider using the search_videos method, which offers more flexible search and sorting options.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideosByUserId
member.summary: Retrieves the videos uploaded by the specified user id. This method can be used to find videos submitted using the old consumer-generated media (CGM) module in Brightcove 2.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideosByCampaignId
member.summary: Gets all the videos associated with the given campaign ID. Campaigns are a feature of the old consumer-generated media (CGM) module in Brightcove 2.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindModifiedVideos
member.summary: Gets all the videos that have been modified since the given time.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideosByText
member.summary: Searches through all the videos in this account, and returns a collection of videos whose name, short description, or long description contain a match for the specified text. Unlike some other Read methods, this method does not provide parameters for sorting the result set. The result set is sorted by relevance. The find_videos_by_text method returns substring matches - words from your search string plus a wildcard (*) at the end; thus, if your search string is "war", the result set will include results such as "warrior", "warfare", and "warbler." Substrings that don't match the beginning of a word are not returned; thus, if your search string is "war", the result set would not include results such as "swarthy" or "inward".

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideosByTags
member.summary: Performs a search on all the tags of the videos in this account, and returns a collection of videos that contain the specified tags. Note that tags are not case-sensitive. This method does not provide parameters for sorting the result set.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideoByIdUnfiltered
member.summary: Finds a single video with the specified ID. Unlike find_video_by_id, this unfiltered version also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideosByIdsUnfiltered
member.summary: Find multiple videos, given their IDs. Unlike find_videos_by_ids, this unfiltered version also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideoByReferenceIdUnfiltered
member.summary: Find a video based on its publisher-assigned reference ID. Unlike find_video_by_reference_id, this unfiltered version also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveReadMethod.FindVideosByReferenceIdsUnfiltered
member.summary: Find multiple videos based on their publisher-assigned reference IDs. Unlike find_videos_by_reference_ids, this unfiltered version also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted.

member.summary: Creates a playlist. This method must be called using an HTTP POST request and JSON parameters. If the playlistType property in the Playlist object you submit is explicit, that means it's a manual playlist. If the playlistType property is not explicit, that means it's a smart playlist.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveWriteMethod.UpdatePlaylist
member.summary: Updates a playlist, specified by playlist ID or reference ID. Either a playlist ID or a reference ID must be supplied. If you are updating the value of the reference ID, then both the playlist ID and reference ID must be supplied. This method must be called using an HTTP POST request and JSON parameters.

member.name: F:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.BrightcoveWriteMethod.GetUploadStatus
member.summary: Call this function in an HTTP POST request to determine the status of an upload. Note that there is a brief delay from the moment you submit a create_video method call and the moment the transaction for that method call is complete. During that interval, a get_upload_status method call will return an error message saying, "Illegal value - Cannot find any video", because the video has not yet been assigned an ID and begun uploading.

Note that that the find_videos_by_reference_ids method cannot handle a referenceId that contain commas, so you may want to avoid using commas in referenceId values.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo.Renditions
member.summary: An collection of Renditions that represent the multi-bitrate streaming renditions available for this Video. A Video should have not more than 10 Renditions. Note that when creating or updating a video, only one of either VideoFullLength and Renditions may be set. If both are set, only Renditions will be submitted to the API and VideoFullLength will be ignored. Note that this property can be accessed with the Media API only with a special read or write token.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo.ShortDescription
member.summary: A short description describing the Video, limited to 250 characters. The shortDescription is a required property when you create a video.

member.summary: The first date this Video is available to be played.

member.summary: A list of Strings representing the tags assigned to this Video. Each tag can be not more than 128 characters, and a video can have no more than 1200 tags.

member.summary: The URL to the thumbnail image associated with this Video. Thumbnails are 120x90 pixels.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo.VideoFullLength

member.summary: The BrightcoveCuePoint object is a marker set at a precise time point in the duration of a video. You can use cue points to trigger mid-roll ads or to separate chapters or scenes in a long-form video.

member.summary: Required. A name for the cue point so that you can refer to it.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.VideoId
member.summary: Although the API docs say that this field is "A list of the ids of one or more videos that this cue point applies to", it appears that in practice this is actually only a single video ID, and not a comma-separated list.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.Time
member.summary: Required. The time of the cue point, measured in milliseconds from the beginning of the video.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.ForceStop
member.summary: If true, the video stops playback at the cue point. This setting is valid only for AD type cue points.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.MetaData
member.summary: A string that can be passed along with a CODE cue point. Not more than 512 characters.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.Type
member.summary: Required. An integer code corresponding to the type of cue point. One of AD or CODE. An Ad cue point is used to trigger mid-roll ad requests. A Code cue point can be used to indicate a chapter or scene break in the video.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.RemoteUrl
member.summary: Required, for remote assets. The complete path to the file hosted on the remote server. If the file is served using progressive download, then you must include the file name and extension for the file. You can also use a URL that re-directs to a URL that includes the file name and extension. If the file is served using Flash streaming, use the remoteStreamName attribute to provide the stream name.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.RemoteStreamName
member.summary: [Optional required for streaming remote assets only] A stream name for Flash streaming appended to the value of the remoteUrl property.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.Url
member.summary: The URL of the rendition file.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.VideoDuration
member.summary: The length of the remote video asset in milliseconds.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.VideoCodec
member.summary: Valid values are SORENSON, ON2, and H264.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.VideoContainer
member.summary: (I can't actually find this property defined in any documentation, but it's returned by the API and seems useful) The container in which the video resides. Will generally be either "MP4" or "VP6" (flash).

member.name: T:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage
member.summary: The BrightcoveImage object represents an image file in Brightcove's system. Images are associated with videos as thumbnail images, video still images, or logo overlays. An image can be a JPEG, GIF, or PNG-formatted image. Note that when creating a new image asset, the only property that is required is type. If you are not uploading a file, the remoteUrl property is also required.

member.summary: A list of the tags that apply to this smart playlist.

member.summary: A number that uniquely identifies the Playlist. This id is automatically assigned when the Playlist is created.

member.summary: The title of this Playlist, limited to 100 characters. The name is a required property when you create a playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.PlaylistType
member.summary:
For a manual playlist, set this to EXPLICIT. For a smart playlist, indicate how to order the playlist by setting this to one of the following choices: OLDEST_TO_NEWEST (by activated date) NEWEST_TO_OLDEST (by activated date) START_DATE_OLDEST_TO_NEWEST START_DATE_NEWEST_TO_OLDEST ALPHABETICAL (by video name) PLAYSTOTAL PLAYS_TRAILING_WEEK
The playlistType is a required property when you create a playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.ReferenceId
member.summary: A user-specified id, limited to 150 characters, that uniquely identifies this Playlist. Note that the find_playlists_by_reference_ids method cannot handle referenceIds that contain commas, so you may want to avoid using commas in referenceId values.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.ShortDescription
member.summary: A short description describing the Playlist, limited to 250 characters.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.TagInclusionRule
member.summary: For a smart playlist, defines whether the video must contain all or contain one or more of the values in filterTags. Use AND for "contains all" and OR for "contains one or more." Not available in Read API methods.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.ThumbnailUrl
member.summary: The URL of the thumbnail associated with this Playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.VideoIds
member.summary: A list of the ids of the Videos that are encapsulated in the Playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.Videos
member.summary: A list of the BrightcoveVideo objects that are encapsulated in the Playlist.
